Notation Description
Otsubscript𝑂𝑡O_{t} The opening price of the cryptocurrency on day t𝑡t.
Ctsubscript𝐶𝑡C_{t} The closing price of the cryptocurrency on day t𝑡t.
N𝑁N The entire time period.
T𝑇T The time window before the movement prediction day.
𝐡tsubscript𝐡𝑡\mathbf{h}_{t} The hard information on trading day t𝑡t.
𝐬tsubscript𝐬𝑡\mathbf{s}_{t} The soft information on trading day t𝑡t.
𝐇tsubscript𝐇𝑡\mathbf{H}_{t} The hard information on a T𝑇T period on trading day t𝑡t.
𝐒tsubscript𝐒𝑡\mathbf{S}_{t} The soft information on a T𝑇T period on trading day t𝑡t.
𝐱𝐭subscript𝐱𝐭\mathbf{x_{t}} The concatenated daily features in 𝐗𝐗\mathbf{X} on trading day t𝑡t.
𝐗𝐗\mathbf{X} The hard and soft information on a T𝑇T period.
E​O​Mt𝐸𝑂subscript𝑀𝑡EOM_{t} The Ease of Movement indicator on trading day t𝑡t.
ytsubscript𝑦𝑡y_{t} The price movement label on trading day t𝑡t.
y^tsubscript^𝑦𝑡\hat{y}_{t} The predicted price movement label on trading day t𝑡t.
references:
Identifying valuable data related to cryptocurrency price fluctuations is the first step in predicting cryptocurrency price movements. Using historical trading data and social media data, we forecast cryptocurrency price movements based on existing research. In addition, we propose a new model that collects data from a wide variety of sources, such as hard and soft data sources, extracts information from these datasets, and finally fuses these data in an effort to predict cryptocurrency prices more accurately.
Table I summarizes the symbols used in this research.
Our goal is to forecast the cryptocurrency price movement on the next trading day (either upward or downward). Price movement can be described as follows.

references:
Lastly, in Section III-C, The multi-source information (𝐇tsubscript𝐇𝑡\mathbf{H}_{t} and 𝐒tsubscript𝐒𝑡\mathbf{S}_{t}) are fused and fed into our proposed classifier to predict the cryptocurrency price trends on the following trading day (yt+1subscript𝑦𝑡1y_{t+1}).
The next subsections go into further detail about the technical components. The names of features and selected indicators in this section are shown in Table II.

We use the yahoofinance111https://finance.yahoo.com/ [41] platform as a credible source to acquire historical quantitative data on cryptocurrencies. This data collection procedure guarantees that we have access to correct and complete information for our study. The dataset that is extracted comprises closing prices, opening prices, high prices, low prices, and daily trading volumes, from which we derive precise hard information [42, 19, 43, 44, 45].
Then we have a stage of choosing the appropriate features, in this stage, after calculating the correlation value, we remove the features that have more than 95% correlation, so the total number of hard features goes from 53 to 36. Table II lists their names and descriptions.

The closing price (C𝐶C), opening price (O𝑂O), highest price (H𝐻H) lowest price (L𝐿L), and volume of trade (V​o​l​u​m​e𝑉𝑜𝑙𝑢𝑚𝑒Volume) featured in Table II can be acquired from the yahoofinance platform. However, the remaining features are computed using the following methodologies:

references:
We also collect our soft data from X platform [50]. To collect the soft data, we first downloaded all tweets of 12 pages that published news about Bitcoin.
News about Bitcoin is reported on these pages in real-time. After the initial checks, 8 pages are selected and their data is used. Between April 6, 2015, and December 31, 2022, we collected 104296 news tweets about Bitcoin.
Table III summarises the statistics of training sets (70%), validation sets (15%), and testing sets (15%).
